trial_identification.studytitle: Te Wai o Rona: Diabetes Prevention Strategy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Te Wai o Rona: Diabetes Prevention Strategy: A randomised cluster controlled trial to prevent Type 2 diabetes by 35% through lifestyle change

interventions.interventions:
Intervention group: medium level coaching supported by community action and ecological change
Intervention duration: minimum 4 years

primaryOutcome.outcome: 35% reduction in incident diabetes over a minimum of 4 years

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Reduction in HBA1c, blood pressure, LDL, triglycerides, cholesterol/HDL, weight, waist, bioimpedance, food items associated with obesity Increase in HDL, fitness, food items, physical activity Rural vs urban, male vs female, older vs younger, "connected" vs less connected Cost-effectiveness over a minimum of 4 years.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Maori aged 28 or more or living in same household as Maori and non Maori aged 28 years or more by 30/9/2005Maori women with past gestational diabetesMaori aged 23 and over by 30/9/2005 with 2 parents with diabetes.

trial_design.concealment: Clusters for intervention concealed until participants allocated where possible, but coaches based in larger clusters, so deducible by some.
trial_design.sequence: Electronic randomisation to cluster within 5 â¿¿size of clusterâ¿ strata rurally and within 2 urban areas and using SPSS v13.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Health Research Council, Waikato District Health Board

secondarysponsor.sponsorname: Ministry of Health, Lakes District Health Board, Local Diabetes team, SPARC many others in kind

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Randomised cluster controlled trial of the impact of lifestyle change on new cases of Type 2 diabetes across whole Maori communities
